content.description: Sit start the double slopey double arête feature to the top.
content.location: It ascends the obvious, white, double arête located about 350 above and left of the Meat Cleaver Boulders.

content.description: Begin with a low sit start, and traverse right to hard exit moves.
content.location: Start sitting on the far left of the right-trending arete.

content.description: Sit start the far left arête with your left hand on a tiny, micro crimp on the left side of the arête and your right hand on a terrible crimp on the steep face. Pull off the ground with good feet, and get left hand to a distant, decent, blocky sidepull. Move your right hand to a small, crimpy sidepull on the face, and then move right and up to top out.
content.location: It ascends the far left arete.

content.description: Sit start on a pile of rocks with your left hand in a slot and your right hand on a small, sharp crimp. Move your left hand up to a good hold, and then move your right hand to the arête. Climb the face and arête, and top out.
content.location: This problem starts roughly in the center of the sheer, gray wall.

content.description: Sit start in the narrow alley with your left hand on a flat hold and your right hand in a decent slot. Move your right hand to a good gaston, then grab a tiny left crimp out left, get your feet high, and gun for the lip.
content.location: This problem is located roughly in the middle of the sheer, gently overhanging face.

content.description: Sit start on a pile of rocks with your left hand in a good slot and your right hand on a thin, sharp crimp. Move your left hand to the good hold on, then move straight up the wall, and top out.
content.location: This problem starts in the middle of the sheer, gray wall.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on a small horn on the arête and your right hand on small, crimpy sidepull out on the face. Bump your left hand up to a better hold on the arête, get you feet up, and match on the giant sloper. Move right and up to top out. This problem does not use the crack to the right.
content.location: This problem is located about 250 feet above and to the left of the Culture Shock Wall problems.

content.description: This is a group of decent boulders with some potential.
